How can Indian youth contribute in changing the country's political scenario?

As it is said natural resources are the backbone of a country, the similar goes for the youth of the country, they are the backbone and the future of our country. In India the majority of the population comprises of the youth who are below the age of 35. The political scenario in India is different from other countries, it follows a multi party system where in there are multiple parties with different political ideologies and concepts. All these parties have in common is the youth organization. The youth plays an important in forming of any party.

          As mentioned in the first paragraph that the youth compromises majority of the population, they play a major role in the Indian political system, as the youth today is well educated and exposed . At  present the political scenario in India is not good as the present political leaders are involved into the scams and scandals. There is corruption widely spread in  our country, to bring transparency into the system the youth has to contribute to the politics and save their future.

          The youth plays a major in changing the political scenario of our country by joining political parties and contributing to bring in some change with their ideologies. Secondly take part in the campaigning of their parties and convince the people to vote for their party and how efficient would their party be. Thirdly the youth can join ngos or voluntarily take the initiatives to educate people about selecting their leader and correct ways of elections. Lastly every youth who is above the age of 18 years who can read and write and has voter id cards should take part in elections and vote the deserving party as their representative

           Therefore, the youth can largely contribute in making India a corruption free country and help in providing a brighter to the future generations.
